review: The Chromecast is a very clever device. Because I enjoy making lists, I shall provide you with two. Yay!*Pros*Casting (on Android) from Netflix or Hulu is easy and smooth. No issues (so far)The device is small and light, making it portable (sort of)HDMI connectionInexpensive*Cons*HDMI connection, if you don't have HDMI, you gots no video!You must use your device as a remote, which makes sense, but if your device locks and you have a security code, you'll need to unlock before you can pause/do other things. Not the biggest deal but for people used to dedicated remotes, this could be annoying.Not many apps can cast so far!*Neutral*LED on the device is somewhat bright. Do with that information what you will.Requires connection to power source. If your TV is mounted on the wall, you'll have an additional cable dangling.
author: Niiiick

review: I'm very impressed how well Chromecast does to mirror your content from phone to TV. My son watches netflix from his iPod to TV with no problems.
author: Jose Renteria

review: Chromecast is really great and I use it all the time. 2 downsides: it does lag a bit sometimes (audio does not exactly sync w. video) when playing video from my local desktop via a Google Chrome tab (I realize this feature is in beta right now), and for some reason I can only cast mp4s from my local desktop to Chromecast, it does not work with avi files which instead just start to re-download to my computer. Actually, this may be a Chrome issue and not a Chromecast issue, but it's still annoying to have to hook up my HDMI cable again.Chromecast works really, really well for casting anything from Nexflix or Youtube. I think it's definitely worth the money.
author: Lucy
